description: This hiking route follows a network of flagged hiking trails (some more visible than others) that will lead you up to Peden Lake. You will have the opportunity to cross the old water pipeline that leads from Sooke Lake to Mt. Wells. The trail eventually ends up at Peden Lake, which has a small cabin and a canoe for public use. PLEASE DO NOT VANDALIZE THIS HIDDEN TREASURE!
directions: From Victoria - turn right before the bridge;follow Sooke Road (Highway 14) all the way to Sooke River Road.Turn left just before crossing the bridge.Go all the way to Sooke Potholes ParkPark in the Crescent Beach Parking Lot.Start hiking south on the Galloping Goose TrailWalk south until you cross the Todd Creek Trestle.The Peden Lake trail head is 20m south of the Todd Creek Trestle.
title: Peden Lake
